text: Wong Uk is one of the 41 constituencies in the Sha Tin District in Hong Kong. The constituency returns one district councillor to the Sha Tin District Council, with an election every four years. The Wong Uk constituency is loosely based on Wong Uk Village, Belair Gardens and Prince of Wales Hospital in Yuen Chau Kok, Sha Tin, with an estimated population of 17,502. ==Councillors represented== {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="2"|Election!!Member!!Party |- |style="background-color: " | | 1991 | rowspan=2| George Wong Fuk-wah | Meeting Point |- |style="background-color: " | | 1994 | Democratic |- |style="background-color: " | | 1994 | Wong Yiu-sang | Democratic |- |style="background-color: " | | 1999 | Leung Chi-wai | Liberal |- | style="background-color: " | | 2015 | rowspan=2| Lai Tsz-yan | Independent |- |style="background-color: " | | 2017 | Community Sha Tin |- |} ==Election results== ===2010s=== ===2000s=== ===1990s=== ==References== Category:Yuen Chau Kok Category:Constituencies of Hong Kong Category:Constituencies of Sha Tin District Council Category:1991 establishments in Hong Kong Category:Constituencies established in 1991
title: Wong Uk (constituency)
